pageTitle: Patent US3552383 - Method and system for estimation of arterial pressure - Google Patents
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {15019=operates to analyze the Korotkoff sounds, classify these sounds into acceptable and loud sounds, accumulate characteristic measures of the acceptable and loud sounds over a sampling period, and control the sampling period. A typical microphone, now shown, adapted for use in detecting K'orotkoff sounds may be placed on the organism such as on the brachial artery of a human. As is well known, the microphone converts the sounds into electrical impulses which are applied through an amplifier 101 and a signal processor 102 to a pair of voltage comparators 103 and 104. The specific form of the signal processor 102 is not critical to the present invention but it is designed for eliminating signals which could not result from Korotkoff sounds. For example, the signal processor could be a filter which filters out low frequency signals or it may be adapted to count the zero crossovers between the maximum and minimum peaks of any given signal. For example, in one specific embodiment acceptable sounds were defined by the following criteria: (1) the sound must be between 200 .and 2,000 digital converter unitsabove the background noise; (2) the sound must be within plus or minus 42 milliseconds of a predetermined average lag time after the occurence of a QRS complex in an EKG waveform; (3) the signal resulting from the sound must have one to three zero crossings between its maximal positive and maximal negative peaks. The zero crossings could be detected by the signal processor 102 thereby eliminating any signals not having the proper number of zero crossings. As will be more fully understood below, the amplitude limits and the time window mentioned above are controlled by the apparatus of FIG. 1. For related sets of conditions, see application Ser. No. 608,130, filed Jan. 9, l967 now Pat. No. 3,450,131, by J. R. textBeforeTable: Patent Citations e. digital to analogue converter connected between said digital storage means and said pressure servo means for converting the digital quantity stored in said storage means into an analogue electrical quantity and applying said analogue electrical quantity to said control input. d. means responsive to said command down signal for decreasing by said incremental amount the digital quantity stored in said digital storage means; and c. means responsive to said command up signal for increasing by an incremental amount the digital quantity stored in said digital storage means; b. a digital storage means for storing a digital quantity; a. a pressure servosystem connected to said pressure applying means for controlling the pressure in said pressure applying means in accordance with an analogue electrical quantity applied to a control input thereof; 30. Apparatus as claimed in claim 29 wherein said two command signals are up and down command signals and said means for changing the pressure comprises; d. means responsive to said generated command signal for changing by a predetermined incremental amount the pressure in said pressure applying means. c. decisional logic means responsive to said accumulated two sets of signals for generating one of two pressure change command signals; and b. means for accumulating each of said two sets of signals for said predetermined sample period; a. voltage comparator means responsive to said detected Korotkoff sounds
